page.title: 06RELIGION IN GODMERSHAM
page.content: The only place of worship is Godmersham Parish Church. This parish is typical of rural Anglicanism: no resident incumbent (Godmersham shares a priest with Crundale, Hastingleigh,Elmsted); few regular worshippers (15 to 20 most Sundays at 11.00 with 30 on the electoral role), but a wide village involvement at festivals and in fund-raising for the fabric (the church has been completely redecorated this year). Church weddings are popular (6 in 1985), Although most Godmersham babies are baptised and 14 children aged 3 to 13 attend Sunday School few of their parents are regular worshippers. Among those who do worship are both Catholic and Methodist denominations as well as the regular Anglican population.
